channel.title: Japan on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Japan on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: Japanese Mitsui chemical plant explosion, monitored via transmissions of NHK World Radio Japan
item.description:
A fire at a chemical plant in Japan killed one and injured dozens, according to broadcasts monitored on international shortwave frequencies and Internet news and trade publication sources.
The NHK news includes news of a chemical plant explosion at Mitsui Chemicals' Iwakuni-Ohtake facility, which straddles areas in Yamaguchi and Hiroshima prefectures. The Mitsui Chemicals site identifies the site of the plant as 1-2, Waki 6-chome, Waki-cho, Kuga-gun, Yamaguchi 740-0061, and says the following chemicals are produced there:

item.title: Japan Aid Benefit Concert with Joe Reilly, Ann Arbor, Sunday, June 5, 2011
item.description: A fundraiser with Joe Reilly for the Japan Earthquake and Tsunami victims. Join on Sunday, June 5, 2011 from 3:30-5:00pm at the Ann Arbor Senior Center in Burns Park (1320 Baldwin Ave.). $7 (or more) per person or $20 (or more) per family at the door. There will be a craft sale on site and all the proceeds go to the Japan Red Cross.  Details: MichiganJapan.com or contact Junko Meschievitz at me.junko@gmail.com .

item.title: Tokyo power outage maps
item.description: Due to extreme impacts of earthquake and tsunami on the Japanese electrical energy grid, power companies in Japan are putting into place scheduled outages to reduce their energy load. Sources Nikkei: Tokyo Electric Power Co. (9501) and Tohoku Electric Power Co. (9506) will implement planned power cuts on a rolling basis . Harvard: Japan Sendai Earthquake Data Portal. A team at the  Harvard Center for Geographic Analysis is collecting and publishing geospatial data about the earthquake. "Illuminating Japan" weblog gakuranman.
